There they lingered: some, wearied out by disappointment and poverty, quitted the Apostolic Court 3 others died3 till at length only one remained, Brother Thomas, who, from extreme want, ⁰ was osten forced to beg his bread. About this time, , Hugh de Nonant, being on his way to Rome, suddenly sickened when in Normandy. Conscious that his death was nigh, he sent far and wide to the Clergy of the Province, entreating them to visit him on his death bed. Before them he confessed his sins. In par- ticular he acknowledged, with great grief, how he had expelled the Monks of Coventry, warring against them with mortal hatred; and, earnestly entreating from the Abbot of Bec-Herlouin, that he might be clothed with the habit of that order which he had persecuted‚ he died.
